c74object.name: fl.random~
c74object.digest: Generates linearly distributed random values in the range [0-1]
c74object.description: The length of the output is dependent on the mode parameter. Output length may be set by parameter or based on that of the trigger input.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Controls how the output length is determined:
[0] - requested - the output length is set by the length parameter.[1] - input - the output length follows the length of the trigger input.
(default: requested)

entry.name: /length [int]
entry.description:
Sets the requested output length in the units specified by the units parameter.
(default: 1)

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the units used for the length parameter.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds
(default: samples)

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.random~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.random~. When set to 0 fl.random~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.random~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
